title: Zurich-focused online couples counseling landing page at /paarberatung-zuerich

requirements.summary: Add a new direct-access route `/paarberatung-zuerich` rendering a dedicated Zurich-focused landing page within the existing Layout.
acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to `/paarberatung-zuerich` renders the new landing page.
The page uses the existing global `Layout` (header/footer) and existing UI components (Button/Card/etc.) to match the current site styling.

file_operations.description: Create the new landing page React component using the existing styling patterns and existing UI components (e.g., shadcn Button/Card) so it fits PaarWeg’s current look and uses the global Layout via the router.
Register a new TanStack Router route for `/paarberatung-zuerich` and wire it to the new ZurichCouplesLandingPage so it is reachable via direct URL.

requirements.summary: Implement calm, reflective German landing page copy and required section structure, explicitly referencing Zurich and using the provided hero headline/subheadline verbatim.
acceptanceCriteria: Hero section contains the exact headline: “Paarberatung Zürich – online neue Wege für eure Beziehung finden”.
Hero section contains the exact subheadline: “Online-Paarberatung & Coaching für Paare aus Zürich – flexibel, diskret, persönlich”.

Page includes distinct sections for: (1) typical couple challenges (e.g., stuck conversations, distance, conflicts), (2) how online counseling works at PaarWeg, (3) PaarWeg attitude/approach (appreciative, solution-oriented, on equal footing), (4) CTA invitation to an initial, non-binding first contact.
Copy avoids exaggerated promises and is consistent with the calm professional tone used on existing pages.

file_operations.description: Add the full section structure and German copy: hero (with verbatim headline/subheadline), challenges section, “so läuft online ab” section, PaarWeg Haltung/Ansatz section, and a calm CTA invitation; ensure Zurich is clearly mentioned while positioning the offer as online.

requirements.summary: Add prominent repeated CTAs that use existing contact/booking conversion paths (Kontakt page and/or existing Calendly URL).
acceptanceCriteria: Landing page includes a prominent CTA button above the fold and at least one CTA repetition near the bottom.
At least one CTA takes the user to an existing conversion path (e.g., `/kontakt` and/or `https://calendly.com/paarweg-info`) without introducing new third-party integrations.

file_operations.description: Implement a primary above-the-fold CTA (e.g., to `/kontakt` and/or existing `https://calendly.com/paarweg-info`) and repeat the CTA near the bottom; reuse existing Button patterns and link behaviors from current pages without adding new integrations.

requirements.summary: Keep the landing page unlisted in the main header and mobile navigation while remaining accessible via direct URL.
acceptanceCriteria: Header desktop navigation and mobile navigation show no link to `/paarberatung-zuerich`.
The page remains accessible via direct URL entry.

file_operations.description: Add a small inline comment/guard near the `navigation` definition documenting that `/paarberatung-zuerich` is intentionally not linked in the menu; ensure no navigation item is added for this route.
Ensure the route remains registered in the router tree so direct URL access works independently of the header/mobile navigation.

requirements.summary: Add page-specific SEO metadata for `/paarberatung-zuerich` (title, description, canonical, and Open Graph tags) aligned with existing pages.
acceptanceCriteria: `document.title` is set on mount and includes “Paarberatung Zürich” and “PaarWeg”.
A meta description exists and references Zurich + online couples counseling/coaching + discreet/confidential/professional positioning.
Open Graph tags (`og:title`, `og:description`, `og:url`) exist and match the page topic.

file_operations.description: On mount, set `document.title`, create/update meta description, create/update canonical link, and create/update Open Graph tags (`og:title`, `og:description`, `og:url`) for `https://www.paarweg.com/paarberatung-zuerich`, mirroring the metadata injection approach used on existing pages.

requirements.summary: Add the new landing page URL to the public sitemap.xml while keeping it unlinked from the menu.
acceptanceCriteria: Existing sitemap entries remain valid XML and unchanged aside from the new addition and an appropriate `lastmod` value for the new entry.

file_operations.description: Add a new `<url>` entry for `https://www.paarweg.com/paarberatung-zuerich` with appropriate `lastmod`, `changefreq`, and `priority`, keeping the XML valid and leaving existing entries unchanged aside from inserting the new entry.
